/>
IX.iii.1.l.10.
b
.
When a Claimant Transfers Property but Takes Income From the Property
If a transferee takes legal title to the property and receives income from the property, a true transfer is deemed to have occurred.  However, if the transferee turns income from the property back to the claimant, the income is countable under
38 CFR 3.271
as a gift of money.
Reference
:  For more information, see
38 CFR 3.276(b)
.
title: M21-1, Part IX, Subpart iii, Chapter 1, Section I - Counting Specific Types of Income
citation: Part IX, Subpart iii, Chapter 1, Section I
